text: Disaster Response Centers will open in the three additional counties later this week.
The #ARtornado did not touch down in Randolph County, but the area received flooding rains from the same system, which is why it's included.
Part of promoting STEM education is making it fun!  Here's @arkmod's Kevin Delaney on @fallonshow Monday night. http://t.co/TzqaZxDfjb
Standing Room Only tonight for the Mayflower-Vilonia baseball game. Great show of support for these communities. Go Eagles! #RebuildTheNest
Governor Beebe is now on board Marine One, will be helping identify areas of #ARtornado damage while touring by air with the President.
Marine One has touched down in Vilonia.
Governor Beebe says the families of those who died were incredibly well-composed and grateful for the President's visit. #ObamaAR
Vilonia High School student Casey Williams stepped up after the storm and became a leading coordinator of volunteers and donations.
Her only goal was to help her town, but today she was in the President's speech, & got her ultimate selfie. #ObamaAR http://t.co/kBWXcF2Ej4
Arkansas has asked @fema to add nine counties to the #ARTornado disaster declaration for public assistance.  News release coming shortly.
And here's the news release: http://t.co/TSWkJNrRWA #ARtornado
Correction:  The request to @fema would add ten counties to the federal disaster declaration, not nine.
We received @fema approval of our request to expand the #ARTornado disaster declaration. Eleven counties now qualify for Public Assistance.
Ben E. Keith announces $60 million expansion in North Little Rock, will add 74 jobs. http://t.co/jkLeXdpwyN #ARJobs
U.S. and Arkansas flags will be lowered to half-staff on Thursday, May 15, to commemorate Peace Officers Memorial Day.
Have a safe and fun Memorial Day weekend. U.S. And Arkansas flags will fly at half-staff Monday to remember the sacrifices of the fallen.
Governor Beebe is releasing $500,000 in State funds to help Pulaski County with debris removal from the #ARTornado. http://t.co/rpIBKtPwAV

"The eyes of the world are upon you. The hopes and prayers of liberty-loving people everywhere march with you." Gen. Eisenhower, Jun 6, 1944
Arkansas flags will fly at half-staff on Saturday, June 7, to honor Dr. Maya Angelou.

Governor Beebe has ordered Arkansas flags to fly at half-staff on Saturday, June 28, to mark the 100-year anniversary of the start of WWI.
Watch Governor Beebe answer questions from Arkansas Governor's School students, Thursday, July 3 at 7:00 p.m. on @AETN.
Governor Beebe is headed to Brinkley to view damage from recent flooding. His tour will begin at 2:00 p.m. Tuesday at Brinkley City Hall.

Governor Beebe spent Friday meeting with more than a dozen Czech companies in Prague.
The companies are involved in many business sectors, including industrial manufacturing, aerospace and small-arms production.
We don't have photos of the meetings, so enjoy a few shots of this beautiful European capital city. http://t.co/LTxC5MYaS8
An official at the U.S. Embassy in Prague says he remembers only three governors making official visits here in the past 15 years.
Governor and Mrs. Beebe in front of the famous Charles Bridge in Prague. http://t.co/C4F7fQ47j6

Governor Beebe announces that his gubernatorial archives will be housed at @ArkansasState. Beebe is the only AR governor who is a graduate.

Qualifying farmers in Craighead, Crittenden, Greene, Lawrence, Mississippi and Poinsett Counties can apply for FSA emergency loans. #arwx
Governor Beebe has proclaimed that State offices will remain closed on Friday, December 26. He took similar action in 2008.
Governor Beebe and Governor-Elect Hutchinson had their first meeting as #s 45 & 46 on Thursday. They discussed Governor's Office operations.
